page.title: 06MARTLESHAM NEW VILLAGE.
page.content: The village has been developed over the last fifteen years on the site of the former Martlesham Heath airfield by the Bradford Property Trust. Mainly heath- lands the site lies just South of the A12 and about l mile west of the original village of Martlesham. A tremendous variety of houses ranging from large detached to smaller terraced accomodation in many different styles and colours have been erected to meet the demands of an incoming population. At the centre of the village lies a square of shops, a bank and other services and also the Douglas Bader public house-opened by the man himself. Nearby is the Community Centre and a large green. The former role of the site is preserved in some of the road names like Gloster, Anson, Hawker and Lancaster.
